description.narrative: The Project would promote agribusiness/food processing through providing access to finance to improve their technologies and increase production, and upgrading and modernizing the plant protection and veterinary services.

activity-description.narrative: The project will be implemented in three rayons - Sheki, Goranboy and Goychay. Within these three rayons, the project will further focus on selected crop wild relatives, cultivated native species and cultivated landraces of wheat, vegetable and forage crops

The project will be implemented in three rayons - Sheki, Goranboy and Goychay. Within these three rayons, the project will further focus on selected crop wild relatives, cultivated native species and cultivated landraces of wheat, vegetable and forage crops

The project will be implemented in three rayons - Sheki, Goranboy and Goychay. Within these three rayons, the project will further focus on selected crop wild relatives, cultivated native species and cultivated landraces of wheat, vegetable and forage crops

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: i) In situ conservation and use of agricultural crop wild relatives and landraces 1. Number and extent (ha) of CWR agro-biodiversity hotspots in the project rayons under some form of conservation tenure 2. Number of the targeted native crop varieties being actively maintained in field genebanks 3. Area under each traditional crop variety (hectares) in the four targeted districts 4. Volume of the targeted native crop seed (tons/annum) made available to seed producers in the project rayons for commercial production 5. Number of new, registered native crop seed producing farmers in the project rayons ii) Capacity of agricultural institutions and farmers to conserve and use crop wild relatives and landraces 6. Number of capacitated extension and advisory service officers deployed in the project rayons 7. Number of state agricultural staff (professional, scientific and technical) participating in project-funded training and skills development programmes 8. Number of active farmer-farmer networks established in project rayons 9. Number of registered members of the regional (i.e. including the project rayons) Wheat Farmers Association 10. Number of local farmers participating in project-funded information-sharing, training and skills development programmes iii) Incentives to plant native crops and market local products derived from native crops 11. Numbers of local farmers benefiting from small grants and average (US$) value of grant/farmer 12. Number of new supply agreements concluded between farmers in the project rayons and processors/retailers of niche high-value products derived from native crops 13. Number of processors and retailers trading in niche high value products derived from native crops, and those benefiting from project grant funding support in the project rayons

1) 4 CWR agrobiodiversity hotspots (100 ha) have been identified as prospective conservation areas. Expeditions to all regions of Azerbaijan were organized in 2019 with participation of the Genetic Resources Institute of ANAS and project experts (8 experts). Totally over 1,000 accessions of cereals, legumes, feed and vegetable crops were collected. Two new biological diversity centers were discovered. 2) Vegetables: >29 Wheat/barley: >67 Forage: >45
Twenty nine (29) varieties of vegetable crops are being cultivated on a plot of the Scientific Research Vegetable Institute and Genetic Resources Institute of ANAS. In addition, varieties belonged to different species of selected vegetable crops were sown in the Goranboy region by the farmer. The field gene bank of 67 varieties and forms of wheat and barley has been created in Shaki, Gobustan, Absheron and Tartar. 45 varieties of feed crops were sown in Regional Experimental Stations and Base Farms at the Agricultural Research Institute and at Absheron experimental station of the Genetic Resources Institute of ANAS for harvesting in 2019. 3) Wheat/barley – 4% Vegetable – 1.2 % Forage – 0.7% Increase din area for local wheat/barley varieties constitute 4% (or 250 ha). In the Sheki, Goranboy and Tartar districts, seeds of the durum/bread wheat and barley species were sown on 250 hectares. Increased in area for vegetable crops (local varieties) by 1.0%(or 5 ha). Forage crops were mainly grown in field genbanks of Genetic Resources Institute of ANAS and Crop Husbandry Institute. Their sowing in large areas will begin in 2020. 4) Vegetables: 0.25 t/yr Wheat/barley: 210 t/yr Forage: 15 t/yr Fruit: 0.1 t/yr The seed material for the winter sowing of 2019 and the spring sowing of 2020 was prepared and provided by farmers. 5) Wheat/Barley: 4 Vegetable – 3 Forage: 1 New varieties were obtained and registered by the Genetic Resources Institute of ANAS, the Institute of Crop husbandry and Institute of Vegetable Growing supported by the project 6) >17, 17 advisory service officers were involved in field genbank assessment and farm monitoring. Their work is regulated by the project management team and based on the information obtained from them, farmers are supported, and their further activities planned. 7) >100, The project provides monthly trainings to the staff of the Ministry of Agriculture and online training reports are available. In 2019, ten (10) seminars were held on “Conservation of genetic resources”, “Vegetable seed production”, “Cereal gene pool and soil degradation”. Specialists, especially young specialists (more thsn 100) from the Genetic Resources Institute of ANAS, Institute of Crop Husbandry, Institute of Vegetable Growing, Azerbaijan State Agrarian University and Baku State University, participated in the seminars, 8) >4, In 2019, 4 farmer-farmer networks have been created. 13 farmers joined to create the network in Sheki district, 45 farmers formed the network in Tartar region and 2 networks were created in Goranboy region (22 farmers, 25 farmers). 9) >55, Support was given for establishing a Farmer Association (more than 55 farmers) in the Sheki district. 10) Vegetable: >110 Forage: >20 Wheat: >120 A training on vegetable plants were held in Goranboy region. Ten (10) trainings on vegetable crops were held with the participation of specialists and 110 farmers. 140 farmers engaged in cereal and feed crops participated in the trainings in Sheki. The training in Sheki was organized both in the field and in the training center established by the project. 11) >170 US$500-US$1500 170 farmers in Sheki, Goranboy, Goychay and Tartar regions were provided with seeds of local varieties and were also given direct support for plant cultivation, agrotechnical care and harvesting. In addition, with the financial support of the project, the farmers lands were analyzed, and appropriate recommendations were prepared. 12) >8, Farmers in Goranboy were provided with equipment for harvesting, cleaning and sorting. In addition, two mills were purchased for farmers engaged in wheat production. Their installation will be completed by the end of the year 13) >8, >3, Large farms were supported in this direction. In addition, the Agrarian Advisory Services located in the regions were provided with equipment that will be used by both farmers and farmer corporations

1) 6 (>150 ha) CWR agrobiodiversity hotspots 2) Vegetables: >8 Wheat/barley: >10 Forage: >2
Number of the targeted native crop varieties being actively maintained in field genebanks 3) Increase in area for wheat/barley varieties by app. 4% Increase in area for vegetable crops by 1.5% Increase in area for forage crops by 1.5% 4) Vegetables: 0.5 t/yr Wheat/barley: 80 t/yr Forage: 30 t/yr Fruit: 0.1 t/yr Volume of the targeted native crop seed (tons/annum) made available to seed producers in the project rayons for commercial production 5) Wheat/Barley: 4 Vegetables: 5 Forage: 2 Number of new, registered native crop seed producing farmers in the project rayons 6) >20 Number of capacitated extension and advisory service officers deployed in the project rayons 7) >30 Number of state agricultural staff (professional, scientific and technical) participating in project-funded training and skills development programmes 8) >6 Number of active farmer-farmer networks established in project rayons 9) >50 Number of registered members of the regional (i.e. including the project rayons) Wheat Farmers Association 10) Vegetable: >150 Forage: >30 Wheat: >100 Number of local farmers participating in project-funded information-sharing, training and skills development programmes 11) >400 US$500-US$1500 Numbers of local farmers benefiting from small grants and average (US$) value of grant/farmer 12) >10 Number of new supply agreements concluded between farmers in the project rayons and processors/retailers of niche high-value products derived from native crops 13) >10 >5 Number of processors and retailers trading in niche high value products derived from native crops, and those benefiting from project grant funding support in the project rayons

1) 6 CWR agrobiodiversity hotspots of 150 ha have been identified as prospective conservation areas. This reporting period the project continued to collect genetic resources, identify new agro-biodiversity hotspots and ensure the active use of these resources in breeding programs through their cultivation, evaluation and selection for traits of agronomic importance. At the beginning of 2020, the project experts prepared an expedition plan, discussed it and agreed on with stakeholders but due to the Covid-19 pandemic only 4 out of 8 planned expeditions materialized. 2) Vegetables: 39 Wheat/barley: 55 Forage: 59
With the project’s support 556 samples of wild ancestral species, natural intra-species and inter-species hybrids of barley, wheat and rye collected during previous expeditions to target regions - Goranboy and Nakhchivan Autonomous Republic were sown in Gobustan Research Experimental Station (RES). Specialists of the station were given advice on relevant agro-technical measures and weed control. This reporting period, field gene banks were also established in Gobustan, Sheki and Absheron; phenological observations were made on sown plant accessions and comparative analysis of samples was performed. Seeds of varieties, as well as studied breeding lines were transferred to the National Gene Bank. 3) Wheat/barley: >4% Vegetable: >1.5 % Forage: >1.0%
Wheat/barley: As a result of the comparative analysis, 6 varieties (4 wheats, 2 barleys) were selected for sowing in 2019 in target regions in more than 9,000 hectares (the total sown area for agricultural crops in Sheki is 75,936 ha, in Goranboy - 42,635 ha, and in Goychay – 22,063). In addition, within the project, the seeds of 4 more varieties of the 1st reproduction were sown on the area of about 100 hectares. Vegetable: In the reporting period, 72 farmers in the Goranboy region were provided with seeds and seedlings of local varieties. Together with the Vegetable Research Institute the project has created a demonstration field of 39 vegetable varieties in 1 ha area in Yolpag village of the Goranboy region. Forage: With the project’s support, the Genetic Resources Institute of ANAS and the Azerbaijan Research Institute of Crop Husbandry of the Ministry of Agriculture established a mutually useful cooperation for the creation of new varieties of fodder plants and the protection of existing collections. A study of 500 varieties and forms of fodder plants is now underway. 4) Vegetables: 0.4 t/yr Wheat/barley: 750 t/yr Forage: 15 t/yr Fruit: 0.1 t/yr The project works closely with the Ministry of Agriculture to improve the seed production system. In the current year, there were no serious problems in organizing the seed production of wheat and barley and planting the obtained seed material in large areas. More than 10 farmers have already started to use the opportunities of the Institute in the preparation of seeds. 5) Wheat/Barley: 5 Vegetables: 4 Forage: 2 In the current year, as a result of joint activities of the Genetic Resources Institute of ANAS and the Scientific Research Institute of Crop Husbandry agroclimatic regionalization of 3 wheat varieties was performed. As for vegetable crops, varieties were created mainly at the Vegetable Research İnstitute, and partly at the Genetic Resources Institute. The project supports the growth of seeds of both regionalized varieties and promising breeding lines. In addition, project experts work with relevant institutions to develop and improve breeding programs. Scientific research institutes are mainly engaged in the seed production of scientific breeding varieties. Within the framework of the project, seminars were organized at the Institutes to increase the knowledge and skills of farmers engaged in seed production. The institutes also organized seminars for farmers with the participation of specialists in this field, and farmers were widely informed in the field of seed production. 6) >18 In the current year, 8 consultants were involved to maintain the field gene banks established in the target regions and provide advisory services to farmers. The project also engages experts for field monitoring on the ground who also collect information and provide advisory services to farmers. With the support of the project, a Whatsapp group was set up for project experts, field monitors and farmers, and questions sent by farmers were answered promptly. 7) >210 There were problems with planned seminars and trainings for 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Nevertheless, three (3) online seminars were organized with specialists from the Genetic Resources Institute of ANAS, the Vegetable Research Institute, Crop Husbandry Institute and Azerbaijan State Agriculture University on topics “Promotion of Plant Genetic Resources Use for Varietal Development and Integration in the Seed System”, “Cultivation technology of vegetable plants” and “Soil erosion, product storage and marketing”. In reporting period, 9 seminars were organized for farmers and specialists. New training materials, such as booklets and books were provided for the training and advisory center established for farmers in Ganja and Sheki. 8) >4 farmer-farmer networks (as reported in 2019) No new farmer-farmer networks were established this reporting period. The project focused on providing support to development of the already created networks such as advisory support, workshops on marketing, subsidies, etc. At present, more than 100 farmers are united in the farmer-farmer networks. 9) >30 All farmers supported by the project are expected to join the association. Relevant meetings were held to strengthen activities in this direction. In addition, at the initiative of the Sheki regional office of the Center for Agrarian Science and Innovation of the Ministry of Agriculture, a Whatsapp group was established for farmers engaged in the cultivation of cereal crops, and project experts were included in this group. Currently, experts are answering the questions of more than 70 farmers in this group. 10) Vegetable: 125 Forage: 27 Wheat: 210 Field & classroom trainings/workshops were by the project during September 2019- February 2020 attended by over 150 farmers. Starting in March 2020, all public events were banned, and most project information-sharing and training events were moved to online platforms. In Sheki and Goranboy districts, however, it was allowed to hold events in the open air, and field trainings were held at demonstration plots. 11) >250 local farmers benefited from the small grants Average value of support (~US$ 800/ farmer). 12) >12 supply agreements
Farmers in Goranboy and Sheki continued to be supported with new equipment for processing of cereal and vegetable crops. Mills constructed in both districts started their operation.
In the target regions, especially in the Goychay region, seed cleaning and fodder mixing machines have been purchased for farmers engaged in the cultivation and processing of fodder crops. With the project’s support the Yolpaq Vegetable producers’ cooperative has been established bringing together local farmers producing vegetables to protect their interests and facilitate access to processors/retailers. The project mostly focused on supporting initiatives of the farmers’ cooperatives such as providing equipments and advisory services. In reporting period, additional 100 farmers have been directly supported with seeds, fertilizers and machinery. Support was also provided to improve the irrigation systems of farmers engaged in the cultivation of vegetables and fruits. In the reporting period, with the support of the project, an eco-tour to the pomegranate orchard called Red Valley was organized with the participation of UNDP, the Ministry of Agriculture, non-governmental organizations, embassy representatives and research institutes. During the tour, participants were informed about the project’s work. Guidelines have been developed for selected farmers to develop agro-tourism in the Target regions that can be directly supported by the project through the purchase of equipment, seeds, fertilizers depending on farmers’ needs. 13) >10 processors >4 In the reporting period, new equipment (mils, seed cleaners and others) were purchased and put into use by farmers and their associations. At the same time, relations have been established with Bravo, the largest market chain in Azerbaijan, and the vegetables produced will be delivered to those markets.
